ALD.NI_MFC package¶

Submodules¶

ALD.NI_MFC.NI_MFC_App module¶

Created on Aug 29, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.NI_MFC.NI_MFC_App.NI_MFC_App(argv=[])¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.base_app.BaseMicroscopeApp

  • Module controls Digital and Analog ports on a National Instruments USB-6001 DAQ controller.
  • This DAQ card provides the electrical interface needed to control connected MKS 1479 Mass Flow Controller via its analog DA-15 connector
  • This device regulates analog voltages needed to adjust or read MFC flow values
  • Opening or closing the connected MFC valve involves toggling digital outputs on National Instruments DAQ card. These are turned on one at a time and serve as overrides to the default setpoint mode on the MFC.
Module Type Module Name Description
Hardware NI_MFC
  • Establishes Read/Write LoggedQuantities for
    setpoint mode operation.
  • Boolean LoggedQuantities, used to open and close
    the MFC valve are overrides to default setpoint mode.
  • Wraps NI DAQ functions needed to carry out commands.
Measurement NI_MFC_Measure Actively reads current flow rate in MFC.
name = 'ni_mfc_app'¶
setup()¶

ALD.NI_MFC.ni_mfc_hardware module¶

Created on Aug 31, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.NI_MFC.ni_mfc_hardware.NI_MFC(app, debug=False)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.hardware.HardwareComponent

Hardware component for use with National Instruments USB-6001 DAQ device.

  • Sets hardware addresses
    • Addresses must mirror those listed in NI MAX utility.
  • Creates Logged Quantities
  • Connects with National Instruments USB-6001 DAQ device through python wrapped NI DAQmx drivers.
  • Establishes software level and hardware dependent settings and limits in setup()
  • Defines functions needed to read and write flow rates to connected Mass Flow Controller.
connect()¶

Creates and instantiates NI task objects thereby creating a connection to the NI ADC/DAC controller Connects logged quantities to their respective functions.

self.settings.valve_open and self.settings.valve_closed serve as override settings. If neither are active, the Mass Flow Controller opens to a degree defined by the setpoint.

disconnect()¶

Disconnects logged quantities from their respective functions Stops NI Tasks and removes Task objects (a proper means of disconnecting from National Instruments hardware.)

name = 'ni_mfc'¶
read_adc_single()¶

Deprecated. Call read_flow1() or read_flow2() Reads voltage off analog in channel 1 (AI 0). In the case of this module, this channel reads the value of our MFC’s Flow Signal Output.

Returns:(float) Analog In voltage.
read_flow1()¶

Reads voltages from all channels of National Instruments card which may or may not have a connected Mass Flow Controller. Stores voltages to self.ai_buffer array. Scales read voltage to flow value. Connected MFC has a manufacturer specified full scale flow rate, which is scaled to a signal of up to +5V.

Returns:(float) Flow rate detected in MFC 1 in units of sccm.
read_flow2()¶

Reads voltages from all channels of National Instruments card which may or may not have a connected Mass Flow Controller. Stores voltages to self.ai_buffer array. Scales read voltage to flow value. Connected MFC has a manufacturer specified full scale flow rate, which is scaled to a signal of up to +5V.

Returns:(float) Flow rate detected in MFC 2 in units of sccm.
setup()¶
  • Defines I/O port addresses.
  • Establishes LoggedQuantities
  • Creates buffers to store MFC flow data.
  • Establishes dict relating pin numbers and the labels used to refer to said pins.
  • Full scale (fs) and limit (lim) values are defined here as self.mfc1_fs and self.mfc1_lim
    respectively.
write_digital_lines(x=None)¶

Writes boolean array to digital in/out (DIO) channels.

write_flow1(flow)¶

Converts user supplied flow value and scales it to a voltage, which is then written to its slot in self.ao_buffer and sent to the National Instruments card. The card then utilizes an analog signal to change the set point on MFC 1.

Each MFC has a manufacturer specified full scale flow rate, which is scaled to a signal of +5V.

Arguments type Description Valid Range
flow float Desired flow rate in MFC. (0.0, Full Scale)
write_flow2(flow)¶

Converts user supplied flow value and scales it to a voltage, which is then written to its slot in self.ao_buffer and sent to the National Instruments card. The card then utilizes an analog signal to change the set point on MFC 2.

Each MFC has a manufacturer specified full scale flow rate, which is scaled to a signal of +5V.

Arguments type Description Valid Range
flow float Desired flow rate in MFC. (0.0, Full Scale)

ALD.NI_MFC.ni_mfc_measure module¶

Created on Aug 31, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.NI_MFC.ni_mfc_measure.NI_MFC_Measure(app)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.measurement.Measurement

Measurement module for use with National Instruments USB-6001 DAQ card.

This measurement module:

  • Connects to lower level hardware component
  • Runs a loop responsible for refreshing hardware component data such that the user can read updated values in realtime.
name = 'ni_mfc_measure'¶
